cmd: The command to run everytime (absolute path prefered). {i} and {j} can be used in the command, they will be replace by the number of the current test and the number of the current iteration of this test
nfrules: This contains 1 object per rule to add

nfrules.output_chain: Set to False to not add to the OUTPUT chain
nfrules.input_chain: Set to False to not add to the INPUT chain
nfrules.proto: The proto to filter on, see iptables doc for format
nfrules.host: The ipv4 or hostname to filter on, see iptables doc for format
nfrules.host6: The ipv6 to filter on, see iptables doc for format
nfrules.port: The tcp/udp port to filter on, see iptables doc for format
nfrules.ipv4: Set to false to disable rules on IPv4 (iptables)
nfrules.ipv6: Set to false to disable rules on IPv6 (ip6tables)
nfrules.qnum: The NFQUEUE number to use, should be even

input: This contains 1 object per modification to apply on the INPUT chain

input.mod_name: Modification name (used to load the module)
input.mod_opts: Some options to pass to the mod (see mod usage)

input.mod_name: Mod with 1 integer as a parameter
Mod with 1 string as a parameter

output: This contains 1 object per modification to apply on the OUTPUT chain

output.mod_name: Force an integer as 1 parameter (same as using an int directly)
Force a string as 1 parameter (same as using a str directly with no prefix)
Specify multiple possible integer as 1 parameter
Specify a range of possible integer as 1 parameter
Specify a range of possible integer as 1 parameter
Specify a range of possible integer as 1 parameter
Specify multiple possible strings as 1 parameter
